snippet: The Federal Housing Administration, a government agency that insures mortgages, has a shortfall of $16.3 billion.
abstract: Independent audit reveals Federal Housing Administration, government agency that insures mortgages, is on the verge of requiring taxpayer financing for the first time in its eight-decade history; audit projects a total shortfall of about $16.3 billion, even as the agency's reserves fell to $3 billion in 2011.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Housing Administration, a government agency that insures mortgages, has a shortfall of $16.3 billion.

headline.seo: F.H.A., Short Billions, May Need Rescue by Taxpayers
